intro: Calophyllum wakamatsui, commonly known as the Japanese white sand tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Calophyllaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by woody, orange-yellow fruits containing numerous seeds. Calophyllum wakamatsui thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or limestone areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
